abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Biodiversity
            Conservation Project is to support the country to strengthen
            Institute for Biodiversity and Protected Areas (IBAP's)
            management of Guinea-Bissau's existing five national
            parks, and pilot the establishment and operation of a
            mechanism to sustainably finance at least two of these
            parks. Negative impacts includes: notification and worker
            safety, air quality, noise, water quality, waste management,
            medical waste, and direct or indirect hazards to public
            traffic and pedestrians by construction activities.
            Mitigation measures includes: 1) the contractor formally
            agrees that all work will be carried out in a safe and
            disciplined manner designed to minimize impacts on
            neighboring residents and environment; 2) the surrounding
            environment shall be kept free of debris to minimize dust,
            there will be no open burning of construction / waste
            material at the site; 3) construction noise will be limited
            to restricted times agreed to in the permit; 4) the site
            will establish appropriate erosion and sediment control
            measures; 5) waste collection and disposal pathways and
            sites will be identified for all major waste types expected
            from demolition and construction activities; 6) appropriate
            storage facilities for medical waste are in place; and 7)
            traffic management system and staff training, especially for
            site access and near-site heavy traffic.
